data.title: Changes not showing in Git view
data.body:
Testing for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23305

- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a change to a file
2. Click the SCM icon in the activity bar

I expect to see the file in the list of changes. 
Actual: I have to click refresh to see the changes. 

Removed "world"

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/24418517/09a7fa34-13a1-11e7-8c57-2d78d2ade502.png)

After clicking the refresh icon

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/24418528/11714810-13a1-11e7-8fde-a25610ae78ea.png)

data.title: UX nit - Git init icon
data.body:
Testing for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23305

- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an empty folder with no git configuration
2. Click the SCM icon in the activity bar

I expect to see a "Git init" action that is more clear. It was unclear to me what clicking the git icon would do.

data.title: Git view commit message box doesn't respect theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Disable SCM preview and reload window
2. Go to the Git view
On default Dark+ theme, the commit message box is light (not themed?)
![git commit message box](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12818376/24416692/80d3707c-139a-11e7-9ad4-435dc3aca9d6.png)

data.title: Streamline prompts for workspace executable settings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (a35c7da7b8f324c1e8cc7830173418e392542f6d, 2017-03-28T12:40:24.966Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #23128 

I like the Allow, Disallow, Cancel options in the shell case because they are more explicit than Yes, No. I also like the use of 'executed' in the PHP case because that is again more explicit than 'customize'. Maybe we could use similar wordings in these prompts?

![screen shot 2017-03-28 at 9 29 47 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/24416446/b1a369e2-1399-11e7-975d-0c1431b6e708.png)

data.title: Workspace specific shell: Move Cancel button in confirmation message to the right
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (a35c7da7b8f324c1e8cc7830173418e392542f6d, 2017-03-28T12:40:24.966Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #23128

The message asking if you want to allow the workspace specific shell to run in the integrated terminal shows `Allow`, `Cancel`, `Disallow` buttons. Having `Cancel` in the middle seems unusual, it should be the last button on the right.

data.title: We need a common checkbox color
data.body:
Refs #23294

Currently there is a editorFindCheckedBorder, this name is too precise. We should have a common checkbox color

data.title: Themes: Consistency on name colors
data.body:
Refs: #23294

Example: Foreground vs panelActiveTitleColor
The second one should also have a foreground so there is some consitency in naming

data.title: [json] extra quote when completing property
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-67-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|java|redhat|0.0.13|
|cmake|twxs|0.0.17|
|cmake-tools|vector-of-bool|0.9.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

![optimised](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26430678/24415265/91f3e6da-13e9-11e7-8307-97c5d4583505.gif)

1. Open tasks.json
2. Remove last ","
3. Start printing "tasks
4. Hit enter

If last "," present, then autocomplete work well.

data.title: File Tree Automatically Focus when closing a file
data.body:
**This is not a bug**

It is more an enhancement 
Thing is when I close a tab (file), file tree changes it focus automatically to the now active file; this is really annoying because many times I just open and close many files (as I'm sure other devs do) and I have to scroll all ways down/up again! Hope you improve this.

Note: Sublime Text doesn't automatically focus the file tree after closing a file.

data.title: customColorTheme empty field gives red color
data.body:
Refs https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23294

1. Add "statusBarBackground": "" to your settings.json
2. Notice that it is red, I would expect it has the color of a theme I am extending

data.title: Feature request: Built in profiler.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A lot of programming languages provide a way to profile your application. 

Some of them are part of the compiler itself (e. g.  Haskell) some of them are just regular scripts that take script name as an argument (e. g. Python). 

They also often provide visual representation of performance and memory allocation in addition to textual one. 

Would it be possible to provide a built in profiler for vscode? 

It imagine it would require following changes :

1) Provide an visual interface.  ( e.g. a profiler button bellow debug button etc. ) 
2) Provide an application interface for extensions.
3) Let volunteers create profiler backends for specific languages.

data.title: No way to easily figure out what are the important colors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23294

1. Try to customize a theme by adding colors
2. Invoke inteli-sense -> there are a lot of colors to choose from
3. Me as a theme writer am a bit confused as to which colors are important for me to change

I understand it has been our design decision to allow theme writers to change every single color but a novice theme writer like me is puzzled by all the options he has. There should be some basic color and advanced to make this more user friendly.

data.title: Breakpoints are cleared between debugging sessions for node loaded scripts
data.body:
Ref: #23283
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Win10
- Node Protocol: inspector only (legacy works)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Initiate node debugging session.
2. Set a breakpoint in any of the <node_internals> file and hit it.
3. Restart debugging session.
4. Old breakpoint is not hit anymore.

It seems to be Windows-specific bug, as works fine on Mac OS.

contextKey on SCMProvider is optional which could make menu entries appear in other SCM Providers
SCM vielwet should by default offer Open File on a SCM Resource

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- Tests: #23311 

Since a SCMResource has a sourceURI which should point to the file location in the workspace we should offer an Open File action on it.

data.title: Last active provider should be remembered after reloading VS Code
data.body:
Testing #23311 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Register a sample SCM provider extension
2. Open VS Code on a workspace folder with above extension
3. Switch SCM provider using the action from command pallette (Switch SCM Provider). Switch to GIT if current is Sample or vice-versa.
4. Reload the window

Expected to remember the choice.

![kapture 2017-03-28 at 16 48 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/24411525/642da208-13d6-11e7-9457-40350b1b2b04.gif)

data.title: Word Wrap: make action always show in minified case
data.body: Also possibly make the editor option "public" in schema.

data.title: SCMProvider needs initial onDidChange event to render anything
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- Tests #23311 

Steps:

-register an SCM provider with resources and groups

Observer: the provider renders nothing in the UI

You need to `eventEmitter.fire(provider);` in our activation.

data.title: Switch SCM Provider is not showing Git
data.body:
Testing #23311 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Register a sample SCM provider extension
2.Open VS Code on a workspace folder with above extension
3.Go to SCM Viewlet and click on context menu in the title
4. Click on Switch SCM Provider action

Expected to show both Git and Sample provider
Observed only Sample provider

Do the same (switch SCM Provider) from command pallette
Both Git and SCM providers are shown

![kapture 2017-03-28 at 16 44 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/24411284/c94f4c0a-13d5-11e7-9c3d-f2b426a080ce.gif)

data.title: Modifying a variable with backslashes in the Variables Window removes the backslashes
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, Build 14393.953

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Define a variable that contains backslashes (e.g. C:\Users\User)
2. Change the variable in the Variables window (e.g. to C:\Users\User1)

Actual Result:
The backslashes will be removed from the variable.
